caption:
This photograph features a wooden signpost with multiple directional signs, each indicating a different location along with the distance to that location. The signs are stacked vertically on a central pole, pointing in various directions. They appear to be hand-painted in white on a dark, possibly black background. The text on the signs is in German.

Starting from the top, the signs list the following destinations:
- "Domeier's"
- "Hermannsdenkmal 3 km"
- "Stadtmitte 1 km"
- "Berlin 8571 km"
- "Berchtesgaden 8100 km"
- "Duluth Private College 3"
- "MÃ¼nchen (Munich) 7956 km"
- "Bahnhof 1 km" (meaning train station)
- "Mittenwald 8047 km"
- "Flughafen 155 km" (meaning airport)

The background of the photograph is softly focused, showing lush green trees, suggesting that the signpost is possibly located in a park or a rural setting. The composition and the handwritten style of the signs add a charming and rustic character to the image.
title: Signpost in the yard of the domeier grocery store, a neighborhood business, on south Minnesota street in New Ulm Minnesota.  The town was founded in 1854 by a group of german immigrants.  Descendants of families from sweden, norway and wales also are clustered in communities within brown county.  The area surrounding New Ulm is predominately farming, but the town owes its growth since 1950 to the arrival of manufacturing firms
